body: $ZIM
A lot of discussion going on about estimated forward dividend yield after the upcoming payout on FY ‚Äô22 results.
Let‚Äôs be clear. For there to be ANY dividend payouts or ANY yield in 2023 and 2024
created_at: ZIM will need to greatly outperform current estimates.

body: Consensus estimates on earnings for the following 2 years is negative. Meaning that there will be no dividend (since 30%-50% of nothing is still nothing).

More specifically EPS estimates for 2023 is -1.52 [range -3.06 to +0.92] and 2024 is -4.95 [range -9.65 to -0.26]. These are VERY negative. It is quite a bad sign when the high estimate is still negative.
Cheerleaders and bag-holders can hope and pray all they want
created_at: but these are likely to be the results. A dividend yield of above 0.0% for ‚Äò23 & ‚Äò24 is only possible with unexpectedly high over performance.

body: These decreases are probably what is behind the big drop in share price from the last few months. My reasons for assuming a big drop in profits and dividends are:

1) return to normal container rates. The 2022 were abnormally large and they seem to be coming down. The company even tell you so in the earning reports ("the increase is driven by increased container rates")
2) estimates from the company. They only publish the EBIT
created_at: but they seem to pay about a 25% income tax
column3: so it is fairly easy to estimate net income from EBIT.

I have done a little bit of research and came up with some guesses regarding $ZIM  Q4 earnings that will be announced on March 13
A lot of people will hate my estimates

body: My estimates for Q4 are as follows:
Net income: $444M (Q4) vs $1.16Bn (Q3 2022)
Dividend: $1.11 ($0.83 actual for me after paying 25% Israeli tax? Q4) vs $2.95 (Q3 2022)
I am not very confident about the dividend. It is just a guess
